question: Customer enabled EIGRPv4 with authentication between two routers, however neighbor adjacency is not established. Which two authentication parameters need to match in EIGRPv4 authentication configuration?
options: Key Variance
Key ID
Key chain
Key AS
Key String

question: Refer to the exhibit. What can the field engineer conclude about the EIGRP authentication between RouterA and RouterB?
options: EIGRP Authentication will fail because the key chain names do not match
EIGRP Authentication will fail because MD5 authentication is only supported with EIGRP named mode
EIGRP Authentication will fail because key ID and EIGRP AS number overlap
EIGRP Authentication will succeed and EIGRP updates can be exchanged
correct_answers: EIGRP Authentication will fail because the key chain names do not match

question: Customer is having an EIGRP summarization issue and needs to know in which scenario the use of EIGRP automatic summarization can cause inconsistent routing in a network.
options: When the routers in an IPv4 network have unique Router IDs
When the routers in an IPv4 network have mismatching EIGRP AS numbers
When the routers in an IPv4 network have matching timers
When the routers in an IPv4 network are connected to discontiguous networks with automatic summarization enabled
correct_answers: When the routers in an IPv4 network are connected to discontiguous networks with automatic summarization enabled

question: Which two commands can be used to verify EIGRP IPv6 authentication?
options: show eigrp authentication detail
show ipv6 eigrp interfaces detail
show ipv6 protocols
show key chain

question: Which show command can be used with EIGRP IPv6 to display the K metric values?
options: show ipv6 eigrp interfaces detail
show ipv6 protocols
show ipv6 eigrp detail
show ipv6 routes detail

question: What are two reasons that can cause an IPv4 route to be missing in EIGRP IPv4 routing table?
options: Passive Interface
Mismatched timers
Better source of information
Split Horizon

question: Which EIGRP IPv4 command can be used to verify if split horizon is enabled and if authentication is being used?
options: show ip eigrp interfaces detail
show ip eigrp details
show ip eigrp authentication
show ipv6 protocols

question: Based on the show command output from EIGRP IPv4 on router R2, what two statements can be concluded?
options: The K metric parameters are left at their default values
R2 is configured as a stub
Variance value has been modified to allow for unequal cost load balancing
Variance value has been modified to allow for equal cost load balancing
correct_answers: The K metric parameters are left at their default values
R2 is configured as a stub

question: Refer to the exhibit. The EIGRP routing table on R2 does not include all networks that are attached to R1. The network statements are properly configured on R1. What is a possible cause of the issue?
options: R2 is configured as a stub
Variance value has been modified to allow for unequal cost load balancing
Variance value has been modified to allow for equal cost load balancing
R2 is not configured as a stub
correct_answers: R2 is configured as a stub

question: Router R1 has recently been configured to operate in an IPv6-only network and is connected via GigabitEthernet 0/0 to router R2. R2 is configured correctly and the link is working fine, but R2 will not form a neighbor relationship with R1. What is the problem?
options: Default route is missing on R2
The interfaces connected to these networks are configured as passive
EIGRP AS number does not match between R1 and R2
auto-summary command is enabled on R1
correct_answers: EIGRP AS number does not match between R1 and R2

question: After the configuration shown is applied on router R1, the exhibited status message is displayed after enabling EIGRP debug command on R1. Router R1 is unable to form a neighbor relationship with R2 on Serial 0/1/0. What is the most likely cause?
options: IPv6 Link local address must be configured on interface Gig0/0
The router ID has not been created on R1
The EIGRP IPv6 process is in shutdown state on R1
EIGRP IPv6 is not activated on Gig0/0
correct_answers: The EIGRP IPv6 process is in shutdown state on R1

question: Which debug command can be used to troubleshoot mismatched Autonomous Systems with EIGRP?
options: debug eigrp mismatch parameters
debug eigrp packets
debug eigrp adjacency
debug ip eigrp packets

question: Which address will EIGRP for IPv6 use as the Router ID (RID)?
options: The highest MAC address that is configured on any enabled interface
The highest IPv6 link-local address configured on any enabled interface
The highest IPv4 address configured on any enabled interface
The highest IPv6 global unicast address configured on any enabled interface
correct_answers: The highest IPv4 address configured on any enabled interface

question: Which statement is true when enabling EIGRPv4 with DMVPN technology?
options: Load balancing must be disabled on hub node
Split horizon must be disabled on hub node
Variance must be enabled across hub and spoke nodes
Spoke nodes must be elected as the Designated Routers for EIGRP
correct_answers: Split horizon must be disabled on hub node

question: What are two reasons that may result in an IPv6 route missing from EIGRP IPv6 routing table?
options: Interface not participating in EIGRP IPv4 routing process
Route filtering
Mismatched authentication
Stub configuration

question: Router CiscoVille has been partially configured for EIGRP authentication. What is missing that would allow successful authentication between EIGRP neighbors?
options: Key chain must be all lower case letters
MD5 authentication is unsupported with EIGRP
The key chain for EIGRP authentication must be also configured under the Serial interfaces
EIGRP authentication is unsupported on Serial interfaces
correct_answers: The key chain for EIGRP authentication must be also configured under the Serial interfaces
